benchmark_config.jira_title: Implement/Test API: POST /1.0/kb/invoiceItems/{invoiceItemId}/customFields - Add custom fields to invoice item

covered: POST Valid Payload: Tests TC01–TC04 cover creation with valid payloads and headers.
Invalid Payload: TC08 (malformed body) and TC11 (extra fields) cover invalid payload handling.
Missing/Invalid Headers and Authorization: TC07 covers missing header; TC12 tests unauthorized access.
Resource Not Found / State Variations: TC05 for non-existent item; TC22/TC23 cover empty/partially populated DB states.
Invalid ID Format: TC06 covers 400 for invalid invoice item ID in path.
Integration GET after POST: TC18 validates persistence via retrieval of created fields.
Edge Case Coverage: TC19 (lengths), TC20 (special chars), TC21 (injection) cover validation and sanitization behavior.
Duplicate Handling: TC17 covers duplicates in field names.
Concurrency: TC16 tests concurrent requests to the same item.
Large Payload Handling: TC14 tests maximum payload size (201 or 413).
System Unavailability: TC13 simulates 503 Service Unavailable during create.
Performance / Latency: TC15 confirms 2-second threshold; TC24 tests degraded performance and TC25 recovery.
gaps: Pagination: GET pagination for listing custom fields is not tested.
Caching/Cache headers: No tests for ETag/Cache-Control headers or client-side caching behavior.
Rate Limiting: No tests for rate limiting/throttling on POST requests.
Observability: No tests for metrics/logging related to create operations.
PUT/PATCH/DELETE: Not applicable to this story; if API expands to these methods, tests should be added.
recommendations: Add GET pagination tests for listing custom fields across pages as data grows.
Add tests for caching headers (ETag/Cache-Control) and caching semantics on GET/POST.
Add rate-limiting tests to validate 429 responses under bursts of POST requests.
Extend coverage to PUT/PATCH/DELETE if the API evolves, and test for idempotent behavior where applicable.
Add observability tests to verify metrics/logs for success and failure paths.
